subject: Re: Is this group defunct?
msgSnippet: I was actually replying to this paragraph by John Cowan. (Apparently I ve forgotten how to quote text in Yahoo Groups.): –What can, and I believe should, be
messageBody:
I was actually replying to this paragraph by John Cowan. (Apparently I've forgotten how to quote text in Yahoo Groups.):

–What can, and I believe should, be done is to establish a writing system that makes the distinctions required by any of the living accents of Standard English.  In this way, English-speakers would easily be able to pronounce any written word according to their own accent, but would have to learn in some cases how a word should be written so as to be read correctly by all English-speakers.  The Read alphabet already provides this in the matter of post-vocalic "r", but would need a few more letters to cover all the vowel sounds of English.
